description: Detailed operational dashboard for Open vSwitch monitoring and troubleshooting

panels.description: System information for the selected OVS instance including hostname, version, and system details.
panels.title: OVS System Info

panels.description: Current status of the OVS stack. UP (green) means the exporter can successfully connect to OVS components. DOWN (red) indicates connection failures.
panels.title: OVS Status

panels.description: Total number of OVS interfaces configured on this system. Includes physical ports, virtual ports, and internal ports.
panels.title: Total Interfaces

panels.description: Total number of flows installed in all datapaths. Higher flow counts indicate more network rules but may impact memory usage.
panels.title: Total Flows

panels.description: Total memory usage across all OVS components and facilities. This includes handlers, revalidators, and various internal data structures.
panels.title: Total Memory Usage

panels.description: Rate of datapath flow lookups. Hits indicate packets matching existing flows. Misses require upcalls to userspace for flow installation.
panels.title: Datapath Lookup Rate

panels.description: Number of flows installed in each datapath. Flows are installed when packets don't match existing rules and require a new flow entry.
panels.title: Datapath Flows

panels.description: Top 10 interfaces by receive bandwidth. Shows the rate of bytes received per second on each interface.

targets.expr: topk(10, rate(ovs_interface_rx_bytes{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"})))

panels.title: Top 10 Interface RX Bandwidth

panels.description: Top 10 interfaces by transmit bandwidth. Shows the rate of bytes transmitted per second on each interface.

targets.expr: topk(10, rate(ovs_interface_tx_bytes{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"})))

panels.title: Top 10 Interface TX Bandwidth

panels.description: Top 10 interfaces by receive packet rate. Higher rates indicate busier interfaces.

targets.expr: topk(10, rate(ovs_interface_rx_packets_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"})))

panels.title: Top 10 Interface RX Packet Rate

panels.description: Top 10 interfaces by transmit packet rate. Higher rates indicate busier interfaces.

targets.expr: topk(10, rate(ovs_interface_tx_packets_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"})))

panels.title: Top 10 Interface TX Packet Rate

panels.description: Rate of interface errors per second. High error rates may indicate hardware issues, MTU mismatches, or driver problems.

targets.expr: rate(ovs_interface_rx_errors_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"}))

rate(ovs_interface_tx_errors_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"}))

panels.title: Interface Errors Rate

panels.description: Rate of dropped packets per second. Drops may indicate buffer overflows, congestion, or policy-based filtering.

targets.expr: rate(ovs_interface_rx_dropped_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"}))

rate(ovs_interface_tx_dropped_total{system_id=~"$system_id"}[5m]) * on(uuid, system_id) group_left(value) (max by (uuid, system_id, value) (ovs_interface_external_ids{system_id=~"$system_id", key="iface-id"}))

panels.title: Interface Drops Rate

panels.description: Number of interfaces attached to each bridge. Shows the size and complexity of each bridge configuration.
panels.title: Interfaces per Bridge

panels.description: Average number of masks visited per packet lookup. This is NOT a percentage - it's the average masks checked per packet. Lower values (1-3) are optimal. Very high values may indicate flow table fragmentation.
panels.title: Datapath Mask Hit Ratio (masks/packet)

panels.description: Detailed information about each datapath interface including bridge assignment, OpenFlow port number, and port type.
panels.title: Datapath Interface Details

panels.description: Memory usage by OVS component and facility. Components include ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server. Facilities include handlers, revalidators, and various caches.
panels.title: Memory Usage by Component & Facility

panels.description: Size of log files for each OVS component. Monitor for unexpected growth which may indicate excessive logging or issues.
panels.title: Log File Sizes

panels.description: Rate of flow-related operations. Includes flow modifications, flushes, and datapath flow operations. High rates may indicate configuration churn.
panels.title: Coverage Events Rate (showing active events only)

panels.description: 5-minute average of various OVS events from coverage statistics. These show internal OVS activity like upcalls, revalidations, and bridge operations.
panels.title: Coverage 5min Averages (showing active events only)

title: OVS Operational Dashboard
